attributes.action: Delay GCSE and A-Level Mock Exams.
attributes.additional_details: The current class of 2021 faces an unfair disadvantage in their education during these unprecedented times, meaning that many students across the UK have missed out on vital course content. However, the government still expects students to sit their Mock Exams in the usual time of November. Thus creating a massive disadvantage to many students, as it prevents students from reaching their top potential grade thus causing them to miss out on a Place at College/Sixth Form of their choice.
attributes.background: Delay the GCSE and A-Level Mock examinations until after the Christmas holidays.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards, individual schools and Ofqual, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
